content.description:
Awesomely fun pocket shopping leads to small overhang and technical crux moving up and left. Use your mojo to get onto small ledge with one last tricky move to anchors.

Thanks to Magic Valley Gear Exchange in Twin Falls for technical assistance.
content.location: ~100 feet left of Pinky Power and immediately right of Majid's Laugh. Distinctive mini-aretes along cliff base in this section.

content.description:
Finger crack and sweet pockets lead to featured roof and big holds. Above that, enjoy another great crack/fin and finish on small ledge at anchors. Power crux at roof and a more techy crux up near fifth bolt.

Thanks to Magic Valley Gear Exchange in Twin Falls for technical assistance.
content.location: About fifteen feet left of Will-Tay-Mul at base of obvious finger crack.

content.description: Small crack in corner leads to small ledge below bomber finger to hand crack with one bolt to right. Route climbs to roof then traverses left following three closely spaced bolts. One final bulge below anchor (crux) completes this fun route.
content.protection: Mixed route: 5-6 bolts and some trad gear needed for crack (small nuts and cams to #2 BD). Chain anchor.
content.location: Route follows left side of the tallest part of cliff. Bolted route (Battle of the Bulge) is ~20 feet left of this route.

content.description: This is a mixed route. Three bolts down low lead to corner and crack. Crux is near third bolt.
content.protection: 3 bolts and a standard rack. Fixed anchor
content.location: Farthest north (right) route on Bridgeview East wall. Start is just left of a block balanced on a pedestal. This route is about 100 feet right (north) of Will-Tay-Mul.

content.description: Ascend face and discontinuous thin cracks to a small ledge. Move past ledge (crux) to another ledge before enjoying the sweet crack in the left-facing dihedral.
content.protection: Standard rack. Chain anchor at top.
content.location: 15-20 feet left of Battle of the Bulge. Start in discontinuous cracks and look for splitter crack in left facing dihedral near top.

content.description:
Enjoy the sweet pocketed lower wall to a tricky fingertip crack move. Solid jugs await and take you to the crux on the upper lichen face below the anchor.

Thanks to Magic Valley Gear Exchange in Twin Falls for technical assistance.
content.location: About 50 or so feet right of Ride 'Em Cowboy and just left of Will-Tay-Mul.

content.description: Techy start to fun pockets leads to break between lava flows and "The Bulge" (crux). Work some magic here and fire through nice edges to anchor.
content.location: About 12 feet left of Ride 'Em Cowboy. Look for bolts down low.

pathTokens: Twin Falls and the Snake River Canyon
